definition: capital letters/uppercase letters/block letters/banker's anti-fraud numerals
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Only the initial letter in the first word of any complimentary close is capitalized.
sentences.chinese: 任何结尾谦称用语都只大写第一个字的第一个字母。

sentences.english: The character which when preceded by an escape character represents any non-upper case character.
sentences.chinese: 前跟转义字符用于表示任意非大写字母的字符。

sentences.english: The first letter of a proper noun must be capitalized.
sentences.chinese: 专用名词的第一个字母必须大写。

sentences.english: It's important the table and column are in uppercase, or the query will not work.
sentences.chinese: 表和列都要用大写字母，这很重要，否则查询将无效。

sentences.english: He's worth three chapters in a textbook.
sentences.chinese: 他的功勋彪炳，值得在教科书里大写特写。

sentences.english: Please complete in BLACK INK using BLOCK CAPITALS, providing as much information as possible.
sentences.chinese: 请用黑色墨水笔填写，要求全部用大写字母。

sentences.english: q1 The heat input is just q1, Q and we'll define that as capital Q.
sentences.chinese: 输入的热是，我们把它定义为大写的。

sentences.english: In this dictionary capital letters are used to cross-refer from one word to another.
sentences.chinese: 本词典用大写字母表示查本词时请参考另一词。

sentences.english: A big arrow and a “Who is this? ” in capital letters appear on the monitor.
sentences.chinese: 一个带着大写字母“这是谁”的大箭头出现在屏幕上。

sentences.english: Capitalizes the first letter of words in the selection .
sentences.chinese: 将所选内容中文本单词的首字母改为大写。

sentences.english: STRING1 shall consist of uppercase LETTERS only.
sentences.chinese: STRING1应当只由大写字母组成。

sentences.english: You sort out these sentences, then copy them, taking care with capital letters.
sentences.chinese: 你把这些句子分类抄写，注意一下首个字母大写。

sentences.english: Palindromes should be reported all in uppercase characters.
sentences.chinese: 全部用大写字母来输出回文。

definition: (neologism c. 2009) don't worry, it's all taken care of
(Internet slang for 然而[ran2 er2]) however
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
(slang) come on, you can't deny it!/don't you think so?!/(melodramatic form of 有沒有|有没有)
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
